Description: Three affiliates of Federated Investors Inc. agreed to pay $72 million to settle charges they harmed long-term mutual fund shareholders by allowing undisclosed market timing and late trading by favored clients and an employee.

The New York Attorney General announced a $100 million settlement -- $35 million in restitution, $45 million in penalties and $20 million in fee reductions -- with Federated Investors to resolve allegations of unlawful trading of mutual funds through market timing. The restitution and penalty portions of the settlement were negotiated together with the SEC, which issued its own announcement; see the Violation Tracker entry at: https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-federated-investors-inc
